movies.title: The Curse of El Charro
movies.plot: In California, Maria has awful nightmares with and visions of her sister that committed suicide one year ago. Her roommate Chris invites Maria to travel with her and her friends Tanya and Rose on vacation to her uncle's house in Saguaro, Arizona, to relax. When the group arrives in the house, they immediately go to a night-club to have fun and chase some local guys for sex; however, the evil El Charro is seeking Maria killing her friends with his machete.
movies.simplePlot: In California, Maria has awful nightmares with and visions of her sister that committed suicide one year ago. Her roommate Chris invites Maria to travel with her and her friends Tanya and ...

biography.bio: Andrew Bryniarski was born on February 13, 1969 in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The 6' 5" is a former bodybuilder. He came to Hollywood for a short summer vacation to visit a friend, was spotted by a talent scout, who set up a screen test for Joel Silver, and all of a sudden he was acting alongside Bruce Willis and James Coburn in Hudson Hawk (1991). Since then, Andrew has worked with Al Pacino, James Woods, Michelle Pfeiffer, Halle Berry, and Cuba Gooding Jr. to mention just a few, as well as Hong Kong's best including Hark Tsui and Woo-Ping Yuen. His film work includes Pearl Harbor (2001), Tim Burton's Batman Returns (1992), Oliver Stone's Any Given Sunday (1999), Rollerball (2002), Scooby-Doo (2002), Street Fighter - L'ultime combat (1994), The Program (1993), and John Singleton's Higher Learning (1995). He also appeared on TV in FX's 44 Minutes: The North Hollywood Shoot-Out (2003), which received enormous ratings and broke several records. His other guest appearances on TV shows has included in L.A. Law (1986), Lois & Clark: The New Adventures of Superman (1993), Firefly (2002), Without a Trace (2002), and Burn Notice (2007). Andrew was included by Entertainment Weekly in 2003's "It List" of the top 100 creative people in Hollywood. He also starred in New Line's The Texas Chainsaw Massacre (2003), playing the killer known as 'Leatherface". He reprised the role in The Texas Chainsaw Massacre: The Beginning (2006). He is involved in all outdoor activities from mountain climbing to horseback riding, and lives a healthy lifestyle, working out at the gym and practicing yoga.
biography.name: Andrew Bryniarski

biography.placeOfBirth: Echo Park, Los Angeles, California, USA
biography.bio: Danny Trejo was born Dan Trejo in Echo Park, Los Angeles, to Alice (Rivera) and Dan Trejo, a construction worker. A child drug addict and criminal, Trejo was in and out of jail for 11 years. While serving time in San Quentin, he won the lightweight and welterweight boxing titles. Imprisoned for armed robbery and drug offenses, he successfully completed a 12-step rehabilitation program that changed his life. While speaking at a Cocaine Anonymous meeting in 1985, Trejo met a young man who later called him for support. Trejo went to meet him at what turned out to be the set of Runaway Train (1985). Trejo was immediately offered a role as a convict extra, probably because of his tough tattooed appearance. Also on the set was a screenwriter who did time with Trejo in San Quentin. Remembering Trejo's boxing skills, the screenwriter offered him $320 per day to train the actors for a boxing match. Director Andrey Konchalovskiy saw Trejo training Eric Roberts and immediately offered him a featured role as Roberts' opponent in the film. Trejo has subsequently appeared in many other films, usually as a tough criminal or villain. Trejo is of Mexican descent.
biography.name: Danny Trejo

biography.bio: Drew Mia is an actor, known for The Curse of El Charro (2005), Chill (2007) and Creepshow 3 (2006).
biography.name: Drew Mia

biography.bio: Kathryn Taylor is an actress and producer, known for A Good Day to Be Black & Sexy (2008), A Tale of Two Sisters (2004) and The Marriage Lottery (2012).
biography.name: Kathryn Taylor

biography.bio: Heidi Androl was born on October 26, 1980 in Unionville, Michigan, USA. She is an actress, known for Playboy Wet & Wild: Slippery When Wet (2000), The Apprentice (2004) and Lingerie Bowl (2005).
biography.name: Heidi Androl

biography.bio: KellyDawn Malloy was born on May 27, 1983 in Lake Arrowhead, California, USA as Kelly Dawn Malloy. She is an actress, known for Mona Lisa Smile (2003), Intoxicated Demons (2005) and The Curse of El Charro (2005).
biography.name: KellyDawn Malloy

biography.bio: Philip Boyd is an American actor and writer in Los Angeles, CA. He currently can be seen on the OWN Network portraying "Oscar" in his third season of Tyler Perry's "The Haves and The Have Nots". He can also be seen on Netflix in the romantic comedy "In-Lawfully Yours" as "Chaz". Philip Boyd was born in Conyers, Georgia. After to moving to Los Angeles, CA, Boyd made several TV appearances early in his career before becoming a well known character on Tyler Perry's "The Have and The Have Nots". Philip recently married the Ukrainian model Polina Sikorska in August 2016. Philip Keith Boyd grew up in Conyers, Georgia with his three brothers. Deeply emerged in sports for his formative years, Philip was more interested in following in his Great Grandfather, Dave Harris's footsteps playing professional baseball. He decided to take a chance and move to Los Angeles to pursue a career in acting. He took acting classes and speech classes to lose his thick Southern accent. In 2006, Boyd shared a "Best Ensemble Cast"m award for his role as "Matt" in "29 Reasons to Run" at the Bare Bones Film Festival. Philip also received a Best Supporting Actor Nominee for his work in "Clones Gone Wild" at the Action on Film Festival in 2009. In 2011, Philip took time away from his acting career and Los Angeles when he learned that his older brother David was diagnosed with Non-Hodgkins Lymphoma. Unforturnately on January 4, 2012, David's battle with cancer ended, leaving behind his wife and two children. After returning to Los Angeles, Philip not only has been hard at work returning to acting and writing, but also expanding his reach to organizations like Camp Kesem. Kesem is a nationwide community, driven by passionate college student leaders, that supports children through and beyond their parent's cancer. By offering innovative, funfilled programs that foster a lasting community, Kesem aims to ensure that every child affected by a parent's cancer is never alone. Upcoming projects for Boyd include the highly anticipated mini series "Fued" by Ryan Murphy, "Do You See Me", and "The Dancing Dodo".!
biography.name: Philip Boyd

biography.bio: Matt Prater is the founder and owner of Dedicated Talent Management, a boutique talent and literary firm that represents a quaint roster of award winning actors, directors, producers, and writers. Under the DTM banner, clients on both the talent and literary rosters are actively collaborating on the development of projects for the market place, with a portfolio consisting of scripted and non-scripted series, as well as feature-length film properties.
biography.name: Matthew Prater

biography.bio: Tabitha Stevens was born on February 16, 1970 in Long Island, New York, USA as Kelly M. Garrette. She is an actress and producer. She has been married to Gary Dean Orona since March 17, 2007. She was previously married to Don Osterholt and Kenji.
biography.name: Tabitha Stevens

biography.bio: Liliana Signorelli is an actress, known for The Curse of El Charro (2005).
biography.name: Liliana Signorelli

biography.bio: Lyndsay Martin is known for her work on The Curse of El Charro (2005), Raspberry & Lavender (2004) and Damn the Past! (2007).
biography.name: Lyndsay Martin

biography.bio: Michela Fruet was born on February 28, 1978 in Italy. She is an actress, known for Seven Mummies (2006), The Curse of El Charro (2005) and Black Angel (2002).
biography.name: Michela Fruet

biography.bio: Victoria Vanegas is known for her work on Cult (2007), The Curse of El Charro (2005) and The Making of 'The Curse of El Charro' (2006).
biography.name: Victoria Vanegas

biography.bio: Lemmy was born on December 24, 1945 in Burslem, Stoke-on-Trent, Staffordshire, England as Ian Fraser Kilmister. He died on December 28, 2015 in Los Angeles, California, USA.
biography.name: Lemmy

biography.bio: James Intveld is an actor, known for The Garage (2006), Clay Pigeons (1998) and Cry-Baby (1990).
biography.name: James Intveld
